WorkItem.Description:
I'm creating a TypeScript version of my streamline.js tutorial. Things were going rather smoothly but I'm now reaching a point where I get a stack overflow when I convert more require statements to import (to get stricter type checking).

There is probably something wrong in one of my source or definition files but the compiler should give me an error, not a stack overflow.

The code is in the attached zip. I get a stack overflow when I run:

tsc tuto8-all.ts

For a bit of context about what I'm doing, see https://github.com/Sage/streamlinejs/tree/typescript
(search the TypeScript section in the page).

Bruno
WorkItem.Summary: Compiler gives stack overflow when I convert a require to import

Comments.Message: Thanks for reporting the bug. We have fixed this issue on our developer branch! Please checkout our developer branch for the latest TypeScript compiler!

Great. I was a bit stuck in my TypeScript investigations. 

Cool stuff btw.
